page.title: 11ANTIQUE SHOP, FAIRWARP
page.content: Three of us went to the Antique Shop by the Fairwarp village green. When we went in we saw some pewter mugs which people used for drinking. Then we saw a concertina and a bull ring spring which they used to lead the bull if it was not ringed. Then she took us into her house where we saw a game cupboard. In this sportsmen put their bullets. We saw a victorian high chair which had had its legs cut off and an old bucket in which they used to collect milk. We saw a bridle for a carthorse with blinkers. Outside the shop there was a mangle. It was very old and made of wood. In the shop there was a big black pot which they put water in and a head which had been sculpted in clay
